original: Holmberg, Axel Ebbe, rektor, Motala, f. 14/5/97 i Ekeby, Malmöh. 1., av folksk:lär. Alfred H. o. Anna Nilsson. G. 37 m. Karin Säfstrand. Barn: Lars o. Astrid ff. 37. — Folksk :lär :ex. 18, stud:ex. 18, fil. kand. 23, fil. mag. 24, fil. lic. 30, fil. dr 31, provår v. Gbgs folksk :sem. 32. Stud:res. t. olika arkiv i Norden 30’-31, Tyskl., Österr., Ital. o. Schweiz 34, Tyskl. o. Ital. 35, Tyskl. 36. Vik. folksk :’lär. i Skän-ninge 18-19, vik. ämnesiär. i Hörby 24- 25, e. o. ämneslär. där 25-26, vik. adj. i Linköp. 27-28, part. vik. lektor o. lär. i övn:sk. v. Gbgs folksk :sem. kort. period. 32, lär. v. Lunds priv. elem:sk. 32-33, ord. lär. där 33-37, lektor i mo-dersm. o. hist. v. Motala h. a. 1. sed. 37, rektor där sed. 45. Led. av styr. f. Nord. filologer i Lund 29-31, led. av sitadsfiulüm. i Motala sed. 43, v. ordf. i Motailta höigerfören. 40-45, led. av ett flert. styr. o^. ikomm.
translated: Holmberg, Axel Ebbe was a principal in Motala. He was born on May 14th, 1897 in Ekeby, Malmöhus county, as the first child of the primary school teacher Alfred H. and Anna Nilsson. He married Karin Säfstrand in 1937, and they had two children together, Lars and Astrid, who were born in 1937. Axel Ebbe graduated from primary school teacher training in 1918, high school in 1918, Bachelor of Arts in 1923, Master of Arts in 1924, licentiate in philosophy in 1930, doctor of philosophy in 1931, and completed a probationary year at Gothenburg primary school seminar in 1932. He also studied at various archives in the Nordic countries from 1930 to 1931, and in Germany, Austria, Italy, and Switzerland in 1934, 1935, and 1936. He worked as a substitute primary school teacher in Skänninge from 1918 to 1919, as a substitute subject teacher in Hörby from 1924 to 1925, as an extra subject teacher there from 1925 to 1926, as a substitute teacher in Linköping from 1927 to 1928, as a part-time substitute lecturer and teacher in practice schools at Gothenburg primary school seminar for a brief period in 1932, and as a teacher at Lund private elementary school from 1932 to 1933. He worked there as a regular teacher from 1933 until 1937 when he became a lecturer in mother tongue and history at Motala higher elementary school. In 1945, he became the principal of the school. From 1929 to 1931, he was a member of the board of Nordic philologists in Lund, and from 1943, he was a member of the city council in Motala. He served as the deputy chairman of the Motala Conservative Association from 1940 to 1945 and was a member of several committees.

education.educationalLevel: probationary year at Gothenburg primary school seminar

lecturer.name: Motala higher elementary school
lecturer.jobTitle: lecturer in mother tongue and history
